description: Retrieves metadata for all crawlers defined in the customer account.

nested_items.name: Crawlers
nested_items.description: A list of crawler metadata.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the crawler.

nested_items.name: Role
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that's used to access customer resources, such as Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) data.

nested_items.name: S3Targets
nested_items.description: Specifies Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) targets.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path to the Amazon S3 target.

nested_items.name: Exclusions
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns used to exclude from the crawl. For more information, see Catalog Tables with a Crawler.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of a connection which allows a job or crawler to access data in Amazon S3 within an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud environment (Amazon VPC).

nested_items.name: SampleSize
nested_items.description: Sets the number of files in each leaf folder to be crawled when crawling sample files in a dataset. If not set, all the files are crawled. A valid value is an integer between 1 and 249.

nested_items.name: EventQueueArn
nested_items.description: A valid Amazon SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:sqs.

nested_items.name: DlqEventQueueArn
nested_items.description: A valid Amazon dead-letter SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:deadLetterQueue.

nested_items.name: JdbcTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies JDBC targets.

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection to use to connect to the JDBC target.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path of the JDBC target.

nested_items.name: Exclusions
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns used to exclude from the crawl. For more information, see Catalog Tables with a Crawler.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnableAdditionalMetadata
nested_items.description: Specify a value of RAWTYPES or COMMENTS to enable additional metadata in table responses. RAWTYPES provides the native-level datatype. COMMENTS provides comments associated with a column or table in the database.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MongoDBTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB targets.

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection to use to connect to the Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB target.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The path of the Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB target (database/collection).

nested_items.name: ScanAll
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to scan all the records, or to sample rows from the table. Scanning all the records can take a long time when the table is not a high throughput table.

nested_items.name: DynamoDBTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Amazon DynamoDB targets.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table to crawl.

nested_items.name: scanAll
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to scan all the records, or to sample rows from the table. Scanning all the records can take a long time when the table is not a high throughput table.

nested_items.name: scanRate
nested_items.description: The percentage of the configured read capacity units to use by the Glue crawler. Read capacity units is a term defined by DynamoDB, and is a numeric value that acts as rate limiter for the number of reads that can be performed on that table per second.

nested_items.name: CatalogTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Glue Data Catalog targets.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the database to be synchronized.

nested_items.name: Tables
nested_items.description: A list of the tables to be synchronized.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection for an Amazon S3-backed Data Catalog table to be a target of the crawl when using a Catalog connection type paired with a NETWORK Connection type.

nested_items.name: EventQueueArn
nested_items.description: A valid Amazon SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:sqs.

nested_items.name: DlqEventQueueArn
nested_items.description: A valid Amazon dead-letter SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:deadLetterQueue.

nested_items.name: DeltaTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Delta data store targets.

nested_items.name: DeltaTables
nested_items.description: A list of the Amazon S3 paths to the Delta tables.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection to use to connect to the Delta table target.

nested_items.name: WriteManifest
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to write the manifest files to the Delta table path.

nested_items.name: CreateNativeDeltaTable
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the crawler will create native tables, to allow integration with query engines that support querying of the Delta transaction log directly.

nested_items.name: IcebergTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Apache Iceberg data store targets.

nested_items.name: Paths
nested_items.description: One or more Amazon S3 paths that contains Iceberg metadata folders as s3://bucket/prefix.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection to use to connect to the Iceberg target.

nested_items.name: Exclusions
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns used to exclude from the crawl. For more information, see Catalog Tables with a Crawler.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaximumTraversalDepth
nested_items.description: The maximum depth of Amazon S3 paths that the crawler can traverse to discover the Iceberg metadata folder in your Amazon S3 path. Used to limit the crawler run time.

nested_items.name: HudiTargets
nested_items.description: Specifies Apache Hudi data store targets.

nested_items.name: Paths
nested_items.description: An array of Amazon S3 location strings for Hudi, each indicating the root folder with which the metadata files for a Hudi table resides. The Hudi folder may be located in a child folder of the root folder.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the connection to use to connect to the Hudi target. If your Hudi files are stored in buckets that require VPC authorization, you can set their connection properties here.

nested_items.name: Exclusions
nested_items.description: A list of glob patterns used to exclude from the crawl. For more information, see Catalog Tables with a Crawler.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaximumTraversalDepth
nested_items.description: The maximum depth of Amazon S3 paths that the crawler can traverse to discover the Hudi metadata folder in your Amazon S3 path. Used to limit the crawler run time.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the database in which the crawler's output is stored.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the crawler.

nested_items.name: Classifiers
nested_items.description: A list of UTF-8 strings that specify the custom classifiers that are associated with the crawler.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RecrawlPolicy
nested_items.description: A policy that specifies whether to crawl the entire dataset again, or to crawl only folders that were added since the last crawler run.

nested_items.name: RecrawlBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to crawl the entire dataset again or to crawl only folders that were added since the last crawler run.

nested_items.name: SchemaChangePolicy
nested_items.description: The policy that specifies update and delete behaviors for the crawler.

nested_items.name: UpdateBehavior
nested_items.description: The update behavior when the crawler finds a changed schema.

nested_items.name: DeleteBehavior
nested_items.description: The deletion behavior when the crawler finds a deleted object.

nested_items.name: LineageConfiguration
nested_items.description: A configuration that specifies whether data lineage is enabled for the crawler.

nested_items.name: CrawlerLineageSettings
nested_items.description: Specifies whether data lineage is enabled for the crawler. Valid values are:
ENABLE: enables data lineage for the crawler.
DISABLE: disables data lineage for the crawler.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the crawler is running, or whether a run is pending.

nested_items.name: TablePrefix
nested_items.description: The prefix added to the names of tables that are created.

nested_items.name: ScheduleExpression
nested_items.description: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the schedule.

nested_items.name: CrawlElapsedTime
nested_items.description: If the crawler is running, contains the total time elapsed since the last crawl began.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time that the crawler was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdated
nested_items.description: The time that the crawler was last updated.

nested_items.name: LastCrawl
nested_items.description: The status of the last crawl, and potentially error information if an error occurred.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status of the last crawl.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: If an error occurred, the error information about the last crawl.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The log group for the last crawl.

nested_items.name: LogStream
nested_items.description: The log stream for the last crawl.

nested_items.name: MessagePrefix
nested_items.description: The prefix for a message about this crawl.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the crawl started.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the crawler.

nested_items.name: Configuration
nested_items.description: Crawler configuration information. This versioned JSON string allows users to specify aspects of a crawler's behavior. For more information, see Setting crawler configuration options.

nested_items.name: CrawlerSecurityConfiguration
nested_items.description: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used by this crawler.

nested_items.name: LakeFormationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the crawler should use Lake Formation credentials for the crawler instead of the IAM role credentials.

nested_items.name: UseLakeFormationCredentials
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use Lake Formation credentials for the crawler instead of the IAM role credentials.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: Required for cross account crawls. For same account crawls as the target data, this can be left as null.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A continuation token, if the returned list has not reached the end of those defined in this customer account.
